Append log messages to a file

Source: R/appenders.R
appender_file.Rd

Log messages are written to a file with basic log rotation: when max number of lines or bytes is defined to be other than Inf, then the log file is renamed with a .1 suffix and a new log file is created. The renaming happens recursively (eg logfile.1 renamed to logfile.2) until the specified max_files, then the oldest file (logfile.{max_files-1}) is deleted.

Usage

appender_file(
  file,
  append = TRUE,
  max_lines = Inf,
  max_bytes = Inf,
  max_files = 1L
)

Arguments

file

path

append

boolean passed to cat defining if the file should be overwritten with the most recent log message instead of appending

max_lines

numeric specifying the maximum number of lines allowed in a file before rotating

max_bytes

numeric specifying the maximum number of bytes allowed in a file before rotating

max_files

integer specifying the maximum number of files to be used in rotation

Value

function taking lines argument

See also

Other log_appenders: appender_async(), appender_console(), appender_kinesis(), appender_pushbullet(), appender_slack(), appender_stdout(), appender_syslog(), appender_tee(), appender_telegram()

Examples

## ##########################################################################
## simple example logging to a file
t <- tempfile()
log_appender(appender_file(t))
for (i in 1:25) log_info(i)
readLines(t)
#>  [1] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 1"  "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 2" 
#>  [3] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 3"  "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 4" 
#>  [5] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 5"  "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 6" 
#>  [7] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 7"  "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 8" 
#>  [9] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 9"  "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 10"
#> [11] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 11" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 12"
#> [13] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 13" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 14"
#> [15] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 15" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 16"
#> [17] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 17" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 18"
#> [19] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 19" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 20"
#> [21] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 21" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 22"
#> [23] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 23" "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 24"
#> [25] "INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 25"

## ##########################################################################
## more complex example of logging to file
## rotated after every 3rd line up to max 5 files

## create a folder storing the log files
t <- tempfile()
dir.create(t)
f <- file.path(t, "log")

## define the file logger with log rotation enabled
log_appender(appender_file(f, max_lines = 3, max_files = 5L))

## enable internal logging to see what's actually happening in the logrotate steps
log_threshold(TRACE, namespace = ".logger")
## log 25 messages
for (i in 1:25) log_info(i)
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 1' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 2' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 3' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] lines: 3, max_lines: 3, bytes: 87, max_bytes: Inf
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] lines >= max_lines || bytes >= max_bytes: TRUE
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] renaming /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.1
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] killing the main file: /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 4' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 5' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 6' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] lines: 3, max_lines: 3, bytes: 87, max_bytes: Inf
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] lines >= max_lines || bytes >= max_bytes: TRUE
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] renaming /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.1 to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.2
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] renaming /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.1
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] killing the main file: /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 7' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 8' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log

#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] renaming /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.1
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] killing the main file: /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log
#> TRACE [2025-01-25 15:06:28] logging 'INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 10' to /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log

## see what was logged
lapply(list.files(t, full.names = TRUE), function(t) {
  cat("\n##", t, "\n")
  cat(readLines(t), sep = "\n")
})
#> 
#> ## /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log 
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 25
#> 
#> ## /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.1 
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 22
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 23
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 24
#> 
#> ## /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.2 
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 19
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 20
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 21

#> ## /tmp/RtmpMl9Wdd/file262f2f2fd608/log.3 
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 16
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 17
#> INFO [2025-01-25 15:06:28] 18
